page.title: 16WYASTONE LEYS
page.content: {Wyastone Leys}(531159)is a large country house which was built for the 19th.C. politician{Campbell-Bannerman. It is now owned by{Nimbus Records} who moved to this location from Birmingham in{1975.}It took 3 years to convert and is now used both as living accomodation and business quarters. The house was chosen because of it's beauty (it has lovely grounds), the room for factory expansion and the easy access to roads (especially to London). Nimbus Records have a {recording studio}on site and a{mobile {unit}which is taken to concerts. they specialise in classical music and have an excellent reputation. They will also produce copies of music which has been produced elsewhere. The{B.B.C.} are major customers. Recordings are made on{L.P.discs (PVC)}and the new 5 inch{Laser Discs. (see page 17).
